item.description:
Join me for a viewing of all the short films nominated for the 2008 Academy Award at a wonderful theater on the waterfront. The Animated Shorts will be shown at 1:00 pm, followed by the Live Action Shorts at 3:30 pm. Afterwards, we'll go to the Legal Test Kitchen for a lively discussion and official predictions of which films should win and which films will win.

2008 Academy Award-Nominated Short Films: Animation - 1:00 pm

Lavatory - Lovestory by Konstantin Bronzit (Russia, 10 min)
Oktapodi by Julien Bocabeille (France, 3 min)
Le Maison en Petits Cubes by Kunio Kato (Japan, 12 min)
This Way Up by Adam Foulkes and Alan Smith (UK, 9 min)
Presto by Doug Sweetland (United States, 5 min)

Plus the following "Commended Films:"
Varmints by Marc Craste (UK, 24 min)
John and Karen by Matthew Walker (UK, 5 min)
Gopher Broke produced by Blur Studios (USA, 4 min)
Skhizein by Jérémy Clapin (France, 14 min)
Hot Dog by Bill Plympton (USA, 6 min)

2008 Academy Award-Nominated Short Films: Live Action - 3:30 pm

Auf Der Strecke (On the Line) by Reto Caffi (30 min.)
New Boy by Steph Green (11 min.)
Toyland by Jochen Freydank (14 min.)
The Pig by Tivi Magnusson and Dorte Høgh (22 min.)
Manon on the Asphalt by Elizabeth Marre and Olivier Pont (15 min.)

Reservations will be made at Legal Test Kitchen at 5:15 for the post-film discussion. Join us, if you can, even if you are not able to see both sets of films. Let me know in your RSVP whether to make a reservation for you. The restaurant is a short walk from the ICA.

There is paid parking at the ICA. The Silver Line can be taken from South Station to/from the ICA for those who wish to take public transportation. Street parking is free on Sunday throughout the city.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the red 'MEETUP' sign throughout the afternoon
